parameters.name: id
parameters.description:
Unique identifier of the __VAR:entity_singular__ to delete.

Must be a valid integer that exists in the database.

parameters.name: force
parameters.description:
Force permanent deletion (if soft deletes are enabled).

- `force=true` - Permanently delete (cannot be restored)
- Default: Soft delete (can be restored)

200.description:
__VAR:entity_singular__ deleted successfully (with message).

Returns success message and optionally the deleted resource data.

204.description:
__VAR:entity_singular__ deleted successfully (no content).

**Recommended response.**

Empty body with HTTP 204 status indicates successful deletion.
This follows REST best practices for DELETE operations.

404.description:
__VAR:entity_singular__ not found.

Returned when:
- ID doesn't exist in database
- Resource already deleted

**Note:** DELETE is idempotent, so 404 can be treated as success
(resource is gone, which is the desired outcome).

403.description:
Forbidden - Permission denied.

User authenticated but lacks permission to delete this resource.

409.description:
Conflict - Cannot delete due to dependencies.

Returned when:
- Foreign key constraint prevents deletion
- Related records exist
- Business rule prevents deletion

message.example: Cannot delete __VAR:entity_singular__ because it has related items.

422.description:
Unprocessable Entity - Business rule violation.

Examples:
- Cannot delete last administrator
- Cannot delete default category
- Cannot delete active items

message.example: Cannot delete the last administrator account.
